Name: HEXACO
Description: A six-factor model of personality structure.

Name: Honesty-Humility
Description: The degree to which a person is fair and genuine in dealing with others. High scorers are sincere and modest; low scorers are deceitful and arrogant.

Name: Fairness
Description: A tendency to be genuine and avoid fraud or corruption. High scorers play by the rules; low scorers are willing to exploit others.

Name: Greed-Avoidance
Description: The tendency to be uninterested in lavish wealth, high social status, or special treatment. High scorers are non-materialistic; low scorers desire wealth and status.

Name: Modesty
Description: The tendency to be humble and unassuming. High scorers see themselves as ordinary people; low scorers feel superior and entitled.

Name: Sincerity
Description: The tendency to be genuine and unwilling to manipulate others. High scorers are straightforward; low scorers can be deceitful or cunning.

Name: Emotionality
Description: The extent to which a person experiences fear, anxiety, and sentimentality. High scorers are more anxious and sentimental; low scorers are brave and emotionally stable.

Name: Anxiety
Description: The tendency to worry in a variety of contexts. High scorers are worriers; low scorers are relaxed and not easily stressed.

Name: Dependence
Description: The need for emotional support from others. High scorers seek reassurance; low scorers feel self-assured and independent.

Name: Fearfulness
Description: The tendency to avoid physical danger. High scorers are fearful and cautious; low scorers are brave and willing to take physical risks.

Name: Sentimentality
Description: The tendency to feel strong emotional bonds with others. High scorers are soft-hearted; low scorers are emotionally detached.

Name: Extraversion
Description: The extent to which a person is outgoing, energetic, and sociable. High scorers are talkative and lively; low scorers are reserved and quiet.

Name: Social Self-Esteem
Description: A person's confidence and comfort in social situations. High scorers feel positively about themselves in social contexts; low scorers feel awkward or shy.

Name: Liveliness
Description: The tendency to be enthusiastic, energetic, and cheerful. High scorers are bubbly and upbeat; low scorers are more somber and serious.

Name: Social Boldness
Description: The tendency to be assertive and confident in leadership or group roles. High scorers are comfortable taking charge; low scorers avoid the spotlight.

Name: Sociability
Description: The preference for being with other people. High scorers enjoy social gatherings; low scorers prefer solitude or small groups.

Name: Agreeableness
Description: The tendency to be compassionate, cooperative, and forgiving. High scorers are gentle and patient; low scorers are quick-tempered and critical.

Name: Flexibility
Description: The willingness to compromise and cooperate. High scorers are adaptable; low scorers are stubborn and argumentative.

Name: Forgiveness
Description: The tendency to forgive those who have caused harm. High scorers readily trust again; low scorers hold grudges.

Name: Gentleness
Description: The tendency to be mild and lenient in judging others. High scorers avoid criticizing others; low scorers are harsh and critical.

Name: Patience
Description: The ability to remain calm and control one's temper. High scorers are slow to anger; low scorers have a short fuse.

Name: Conscientiousness
Description: The degree to which a person is organized, diligent, and prudent. High scorers are disciplined and reliable; low scorers are disorganized and careless.

Name: Diligence
Description: The tendency to work hard and be committed to one's tasks. High scorers are industrious; low scorers are less motivated and may procrastinate.

Name: Organization
Description: The tendency to be tidy and systematic. High scorers like order and structure; low scorers are more messy and unstructured.

Name: Perfectionism
Description: The tendency to be meticulous and detail-oriented. High scorers strive for precision; low scorers are content with "good enough."

Name: Prudence
Description: The tendency to be cautious and deliberate. High scorers think before they act; low scorers are more impulsive and reckless.

Name: Openness to Experience
Description: The extent to which a person is creative, curious, and unconventional. High scorers enjoy art, ideas, and new experiences; low scorers prefer the conventional and familiar.

Name: Aesthetic Appreciation
Description: The enjoyment of beauty in art and nature. High scorers are moved by beauty; low scorers are less interested in aesthetics.

Name: Creativity
Description: The tendency to be imaginative and innovative. High scorers enjoy creating new things and ideas; low scorers are less imaginative.

Name: Inquisitiveness
Description: The desire to seek out new information and experiences. High scorers are curious and enjoy learning; low scorers are less intellectually curious.

Name: Unconventionality
Description: The willingness to accept the unusual. High scorers are receptive to novel ideas; low scorers are more traditional.

Name: Dark Tetrad
Description: A cluster of four socially aversive personality traits. High scores indicate tendencies towards manipulation, self-obsession, low empathy, and cruelty.

Name: Dark Tetrad
Description: The overall score for the four aversive traits.

Name: Machiavellianism
Description: The tendency to be cynical, strategic, and manipulative for personal gain. High scorers view others as tools to achieve their goals.

Name: Narcissism
Description: The tendency to be grandiose, entitled, and require admiration from others. High scorers have an inflated sense of self-importance.

Name: Psychopathy
Description: Characterized by low empathy, impulsivity, and thrill-seeking. High scorers have a weak conscience and a disregard for others' feelings.

Name: Sadism
Description: The tendency to derive pleasure from the suffering of others. High scorers may enjoy being cruel or humiliating to others.
